results.title: What do I know about Benny?
results.brief_description: Benny is achieving low grades in school and his discipline is poor. His mother discuses the situation with the school principal. The principal attempts to explain that Benny was achieving up to his ability level. The mother rejects this and blames his performance on bad teaching.

results.title: What are words worth: copyright, CAL & sampling
results.creator_credit: Barry Jacobs, Copyright Agency Ltd and Serious Business TV Production
results.brief_description: The purpose of copyright is to protect the intellectual property of writers thus ensuring they are given the renumeration to which they are entitled. This program explains copyright issues such as the function of CAL and why it conducts copying surveys, the importance of copyright protection not only for authors but the whole community and the advantages of a centralised licensing and CAL sampling system. The program uses role play with actors to impart the important message about copyright.

results.title: What's in a symbol?
results.creator_credit: Gyorgy Karpati and League of Red Cross Societies et al
results.brief_description: A documentary of the history and activities of the Red Cross from its foundation in 1859 to the present day. Emphasises its role in providing help and protection to citizens worldwide. Depicts delegates and volunteers at work in war zones, assisting refugees and prisoners, tracing families and working with the urban poor and drug addicts.

results.title: Westminster Abbey. - [Rev. version]
results.brief_description: This film is a revised version of “Westminster Abbey, Title Code 011796”. It traces the history of Westminster Abbey in relationship to its importance in the life of the English Church and nation and as a valuable record of the development of English eccleseastical architecture over the centuries. Musical score by Ecaro Pastore. Narration by Terence Alexander.

results.title: Western waterways
results.brief_description: From its source in the Cotswold Hills, the Bristol Avon River winds its way through quiet pastoral country, presently reaching the city of Bath, famous for its period architecture and its mineral springs. The Avon flows through the industrial city of Bristol, one of the busiest ports of Britain, and near the sea at Avonmouth, the dockyards line the river banks.

results.title: Welcoming valley: the mighty Murray
results.brief_description: Victorian Government promotional film extolling the virtues of the Murray River Valley as a tourist destination. Includes footage of Yarrawonga/Mulwala, Echuca, Cohuna, Kerang, Swan Hill and Mildura.

results.title: Weighing the choices: positive approaches to nutrition (TEFC
results.brief_description: This film provides practical choices for meals. It does not suggest totally eliminating certain foods from the diet, but rather consciously selecting some things more often than others in order to be healthier. There is an added benefit of weight control for people who maintain a healthy diet

results.title: Weekend Magazine: William Strutt
results.brief_description: Against the background of a Parliament House launching of Marjorie Tipping’s book “Victoria the Golden”, this film focuses on the watercolors of William Strutt, painted during the gold rush period in Victoria. They depict scenes of watercarters, the goldfields, people on their way to the diggings, women doing traditional men’s work in Melbourne when the men left to search for gold, the opening of the Legislative Council and the departure of the Burke and Wills expedition from Melbourne. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We need to talk: employer/employee communication
results.brief_description: This business management resource has been designed by professionals with people management experience in a variety of industries including finance, manufacturing, hospitality and information services. The program is intended for use in a self study or group situation and details seven steps that comprise a successful agenda for meetings, as well as key counselling techniques. These steps and techniques are put into practice through two typical workplace scenarios.
